item.title: Deploying a Hugo Blog with GitHub Actions
item.description: We already can use Travis-CI and Netlify to build and deploy Static Sites, Today we introduce a new way to automate and customize your workflows–GitHub Actions. But we’re just scratching the surface of what GitHub Actions can do. Once you get started, you’ll be able to build, package, release, update, and deploy your project in any language—on GitHub or any external system—without having to run code yourself. Sign up for the limited public beta of GitHub Actions
